alert.note: Alert for Newton; Rockdale (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 10:39AM EST until January 12 at 6:27AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Yellow River at Gees Mill Road affecting Rockdale and Newton Counties. Yellow River at Pleasant Hill Road near Lithonia affecting DeKalb and Rockdale Counties. For the Yellow River Basin...including Suwanee, Lawrenceville, Plantation Rd Lawrenceville, Lilburn, Tanglewood Drive Snellville, Snellville, Snellville, Silver Hill Rd Stone Mtn, Lithonia, Stone Mountain, Lee Road below Snellville, Lithonia, Lithonia, Lithonia, Milstead, Gees Mill Road, Snellville, Loganville, Milstead, Milstead, Milstead, Rocky Plains...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Yellow River at Gees Mill Road. * WHEN...Until Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Minor flooding continues to expand into the woodlands...fields and pasture along the river upstream and downstream from the gage on Gees Mill Road in Rockdale County. Most of Sockwell Road by the river in Newton County will be flooded with up to 4 feet of water. Minor flooding also occurs in Newton County in the Riverside Estates Travel and Trailer Park. Any trailers near the river may need to be moved to higher ground. A playground by the river will begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 14.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 AM EST Wednesday was 14.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Friday morning and continue falling to 2.5 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.3 feet on 03/20/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1045 PM EST.
